required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Outcome of the TVT Procedure Without Preoperative Urodynamic Examination
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Outcome of the TVT Procedure Without Preoperative Urodynamic Examination

brief_summary.textblock: A follow-up study of 191 patients operated on with the TVT procedure between January 1998 and May 2000 at the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology in the Turku City Hospital. After a mean of 10.5 years patients were invited to a follow-up visit. Subjective outcome was evaluated with condition-specific and general quality of life and health questionnaires. Objective outcome was evaluated with gynaecological examination and a supine stress test. Objective cure was defined as a negative stress test and no need for a reoperation for SUI and subjective cure.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective outcome of the TVT operation
primary_outcome.description: Objective outcome was measured with negative stress test and no need for reoperation for stress urinary incontinence during the follow-up.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients operated on with the TVT

intervention.intervention_name: Gynaecological examination and a supine stress test, questionnaires
intervention.description: Gynaecological examination and a supine stress test, questionnaires
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients operated on with the TVT

study_pop.textblock: 191 female patients with genuine or recurrent stress urinary incontinence or mixed incontinence operated on with the TVT procedure at the mean of 10.5 years ago.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 191 patients operated on with the TVT procedure between January 1998 and May 2000 at the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology in the Turku City Hospital
